item.title: Using Python with R Markdown
item.description: This post shows how the package reticulate can be utilized in an R Markdown to converse to python. This example uses matrices and their properties to explore differnt characteristics of python. First, a randamized matrix is made in a r code block. set.seed(123) matrix <- matrix(round(13 * rexp(200)), 10) This matrix variable can be called in a python code block and converted to an array. Numpy can also imported so itâ€™s functions can be used on the array.
